snippet: The United States and six Arab countries called for setting a specific deadline for Syria to halt the violence against the opposition.
abstract: Syrian forces will not pull out of towns and cities that have been centers of the yearlong uprising until 'normal life' resumes there, raising new questions about prospects for carrying out a United Nations-backed peace plan; for the first time, the six Arab Countries of the Gulf Cooperation Council and the United States call for setting a deadline for Syria to halt the violence against the opposition and to allow medical aid to reach victims, steps that Syria’s president, Bashar al-Assad, has publicly pledged to take under the peace plan.

byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

lead_paragraph: The United States and six Arab countries called for setting a specific deadline for Syria to halt the violence against the opposition.

headline.seo: Syria Won’t Quit Rebel Centers, Putting Cease-Fire in Doubt
headline.main: Syria Won’t Pull Out of Rebel Centers
headline.print_headline: Syria Won’t Pull Out of Rebel Centers
